issues.description: The solution implements the order-serving logic in a method named `processOrders()` instead of the specified `checkOrderReady()` method in the problem statement. The solution has no `checkOrderReady()` method, which conflicts with the API students are instructed to create and will cause confusion when they try to follow the specification.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the `processOrders()` method in `SealSaloon` to `checkOrderReady()` (or add a `checkOrderReady()` stub that delegates to `processOrders()`), so the solution matches the problem specification.

issues.description: The problem statement specifies a method named `checkOrderReady()`, but the solution implements this functionality in a method called `processOrders()`. Students following the problem will look for `checkOrderReady()` in the template/solution and be unable to find it, breaking the mapping between requirements and code.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the `processOrders()` method in SealSaloon to `checkOrderReady()`, and update calls accordingly, so the implementation matches the method name described in the problem statement.
